Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: They dont have the RPC to fetch it, and the algo for extracting the data would break in a normal chain.... it makes a shit load of assumptions to work

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: each chunk must be in the tx directly after the previous chunk

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: it will skip any txs without an OPreturn at the 3rd vout... so that notarisations can still work

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: but not sure a normal chain would work at all

@blackjok3r @CrisF @jl777c @CHMEX @libscott @smk762 -  dracocanis ominator @Deleted User @webworker01 @ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢ @Mylo @TonyL @Nabob @CMaurice 

Please read http://pad.supernet.org/staked_proposals about signers. We are asking you to be one. 

If you can be a signer, please leave an üëå  emoji on this post. I will contact you to get your pubkey.

We don't need 100% of signers to sign each bi-weekly transaction, just some %. The % will be based on response to this message.

For the time being, a signers job is to check that (% of notarizations = % of biweekly payment). We will make this easy to verify.

We will work on the process of collectively signing a transaction.

This is a temporary solution until we can have real pay per notarization working.
